intro: Parastriga alectroides, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and used traditionally for various purposes. The plant has small, green leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in savanna habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural use.
